# evaluate(with:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the specified object matches the conditions that the predicate specifies.

## Declaration

```swift
func evaluate(with object: Any?) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **object**: The object against which to evaluate the predicate.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if `object` matches the conditions specified by the predicate, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Evaluating a Predicate

- **evaluate(with:substitutionVariables:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the specified object matches the conditions that the predicate specifies after substituting in the values from a specified variables dictionary.
- **allowEvaluation()**: Forces a securely decoded predicate to allow evaluation.
